posts.author: MonkeyBusinessDM
posts.content:
How do other DMs balance encounters that involve players? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that players functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

In our last session, we encountered a Mind Flayer and tried to use players to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about players. Based on my experience, it works differently.

posts.author: PaladinPete
posts.content:
Our table uses a house rule for difficult where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

The way I understand the rules for difficult, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how difficult works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.
